intro: Microstylis platycheila, commonly known as the flat-leaf microstylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, flat leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Microstylis platycheila plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
